text: is a prefecture in the Tōhoku region of Japan. It is on the island of Honshu. The capital city is Morioka. == History == The area of Iwate was part of Mutsu Province. In 1869, Mutsu was split into five new provinces: Rikuōku, Rikuchū, Rikuzen, Iwashiro and Iwaki. The first three of these together known as the "Three Riku", or Sanriku.Nippon-Kichi, "Saw-tooth Sanriku Coastline". Retrieved 2012-1-12. The new provinces were abolished in July 1871.Japan-i, Sanriku Coastline/Kamaishi Daikannon . Retrieved 2012-1-12. In the Meiji period, the provinces of Japan were converted into prefectures. Maps of Japan and Mutsu Province were changed in the 1870s. ==Geography== Iwate is the second largest prefecture after Hokkaido. The prefecture is in the Tōhoku region of Honshū island. It has the island's easternmost point. The eastern coastline faces the Pacific Ocean. Iwate shares its northern border with Aomori Prefecture. The western border meets Akita Prefecture.
